main event: A bright silver-color object was observed descending from high altitude, then climbing and disappearing in Van Wert, Ohio in April 1959.
interesting points: The object was visible for several minutes before it disappeared into the clouds., The object was described as circular, resembling a disc or dime., Observers reported the skies were overcast in spots during the sighting., The object was estimated to be at an altitude exceeding 5000 ft., A hand-drawn sketch depicted the object with markings that seemed to resemble 'hinds' and showed its size as 40 ft.
